laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated erythromycin disk induction of clindamycin resistance; presence of inducible macrolide–lincosamide–streptogramin B (iMLS) resistance in pretreatment isolate.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Erythromycin induction testing confirmed presence of iMLS in 90 (56%) of 161 erythromycin-resistant, clindamycin-susceptible clinical S. aureus isolates overall.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Moderate number of polymorphonuclear leukocytes and a few gram-positive cocci observed.

MRSA grown from culture; susceptible to vancomycin (MIC, 1 mg/mL), clindamycin (MIC, 0.5 mg/mL), and tetracycline (MIC, 2 mg/mL); resistant to erythromycin (MIC, 14 mg/mL) and gatifloxacin (MIC, 14 mg/mL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Organism was susceptible to clindamycin before treatment but resistant post-clindamycin treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: MRSA with an antibiotic susceptibility profile identical to that of the previous isolate, except that they were resistant to clindamycin (MIC, 12 mg/dL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The susceptibility profile changed with new isolate being resistant to clindamycin after treatment.
